intro: The Communication and Signal Processing Research Group focuses on the development, analysis, and application of techniques for transmitting, receiving, and processing information-bearing signals. The group conducts both theoretical and experimental research across various domains of modern communication systems.

keyActivities.title: Digital Signal Processing (DSP)
keyActivities.desc: Developing algorithms for signal enhancement, filtering, compression, and feature extraction.

keyActivities.title: Wireless Communication Systems
keyActivities.desc: Investigating physical layer protocols for 5G, 6G, and future wireless technologies.

keyActivities.title: MIMO and Beamforming
keyActivities.desc: Exploring spatial signal processing techniques to increase channel capacity and reliability.

keyActivities.title: Machine Learning for Signal Processing
keyActivities.desc: Applying AI and deep learning models to improve communication system performance, especially in dynamic environments.

keyActivities.title: Software-Defined Radio (SDR) and Embedded Systems
keyActivities.desc: Implementing and testing real-time communication algorithms on hardware platforms.

keyActivities.title: Spectrum Sensing and Cognitive Radio
keyActivities.desc: Researching adaptive spectrum access techniques for dynamic spectrum allocation.

keyActivities.title: Audio Video Transmision
keyActivities.desc: Researching Audio and Video in Telecommunication Systems.
